pr_title: Fix typos and improve clarity in FAQ

timeline.bodyText:
72 hours

The terms of service say two days. Which is correct?
timeline.author: em1
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -194,12 +194,12 @@ Already using or testing wth FHIR, especially Bulk FHIR
-

Yes! The emergency room scenario is a great use of claims data. When adding patients to the roster from an emergency room, the time period will be 72 hours instead of the 90 days that occurs for outpatient visits. Otherwise, you can add patients to your roster as they are admitted to the emergency room.

+

Yes! The emergency room scenario is a great use of claims data. When adding patients to the roster from an emergency room, the attribution time period will be 72 hours instead of the 90 days that occurs for outpatient visits.

replies.bodyText: @amgleason recommended removing. I've changed it to say only that patients can be added to a roster from the ER, with no time period.
replies.author: em1
